channel.title: Track Renaming Bug
channel.description:
I have this problem in which renaming a track will reset it to what it was previously.
iPhone 6s running the latest iOS firmware
https://youtu.be/vn-fJ5k-Im0

item.title: Track Renaming Bug
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
that’s what used to happen (it would just put the number 2 next to it) but in the new update this has been happening to me where if a project of that name exists it just doesn’t name it

Read full topic

item.title: Track Renaming Bug
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
No it will have a #2 next to it

Read full topic

item.title: Track Renaming Bug
item.dc:creator: icelight
item.description:
I noticed this as well, and I think it seems to happen when you try to rename a project to the name of an existing project.

(Previously it would add a 2 to the end) I only saw this after the most recent update

Hope this helps with trying to narrow it down^^

Read full topic

item.title: Track Renaming Bug
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
I’ve tested other projects as well. It seems to be an issue when I change the title to something with exactly 3 Cs.

It’s hard to describe it. I tried to rename one of my tracks to City Electric but then reverted back to what it was before.

Read full topic

item.title: Track Renaming Bug
item.dc:creator: obexg
item.description:
Yes this is. It happened to me three times.

Read full topic

item.title: Track Renaming Bug
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
Is this happening all the time, i.e. you’re not able to rename any projects, or just for this project?

Read full topic
